extendedInfo.description: The health benefits of a diet rich in fruits and vegetables outweigh the risks of pesticide exposure. Use EWG's Shopper's Guide to Pesticidesâ¢ to reduce your exposures as much as possible, but eating conventionally-grown produce is far better than not eating fruits and vegetables at all. The Shopper's Guide to Pesticides in Produceâ¢ will help you determine which fruits and vegetables have the most pesticide residues and are the most important to buy organic. You can lower your pesticide intake by avoiding the 12 most contaminated fruits and vegetables and choosing the least contaminated produce.For the second year, we have expanded the Dirty Dozenâ¢ with a Plus category to highlight two crops â domestically-grown summer squash and leafy greens, specifically kale and collards. These crops did not meet traditional Dirty Dozenâ¢ criteria but were commonly contaminated with pesticides exceptionally toxic to the nervous system.Commodity crop corn used for animal feed and biofuels is almost all produced with genetically modified (GMO) seeds, as is some sweet corn sold for human consumption. Since GMO sweet corn is not labeled as such in US stores, EWG advises those who have concerns about GMOs to buy organic sweet corn.

reviews.title: Very good, but not mention gmo
reviews.comment: Very good app. But did not mention that sweet core and papaya are most likely gmo products. That\'s even worse than insectcide.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: If only we had more of these type of apps! Important information distilled to a simple presentation, no ads, no bs. My only request would be to provide access to the raw data, for those interested. Maybe this version already has that feature, but I didn\'t see it.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great shopping buddy!
reviews.comment: Really helpful when shopping at supermarkets or farm markets. Knowing what questions to ask is important to keep pesticides off your table.

reviews.title: Respects my privacy.
reviews.comment: No permissions requested. That means it is not spying on my friends, location, or surfing habits. Very appreaciated.

reviews.title: Great idea not enough information
reviews.comment: I love the idea but would like more information on what are the pesticides out other harmful additives are on all food listed so not only could I learn more but I could help others understand like my children our that random person in the supermarket that all for you opinion
